data.name: Second Moment Of Area
data.description: Second moments of area (formulas for this Kata): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_second_moments_of_area We want to return second moment of area for a given cross-section of a beam. Only x-axis and 2 decimal places in the result. x and y axis cross in the center of the shape. For example: getData("rectangle", new int[] {5,10}): width = 5, height = 10; Ix = h^3 * w / 12 = 10^3 * 5 /12 = 416.67 result: 416.67 // 2 decimal places! If shape is not one of 6 mentioned above, return String "I don't know that shape man!". If shape is ok, but double[] size has less or more data than needed, return String "The length of the size-array is wrong!". There will be 6 possible shapes: getData("circle", new double[] {5}) --> 5 is a diameter getData("square", new double[] {5}) --> 5 is a side length getData("rectangle", new double[] {5,10}) --> 5 is a width, 10 is a height getData("circlePipe", new double[] {25,2}) --> 25 is a diameter, 2 is a wall-thickness getData("squarePipe", new double[] {10,1}) --> 10 is a side length, 1 is a wall thickness getData("rectanglePipe", new double[] {25,15,3}) --> 25 is a width, 15 is a height, 5 is a wall-thickness + Must work with circle, CIRCLE, ciRcLe, etc. + The situation where walls are thicker than physically possible (for example 10 diameter circle and 6 wall thickness) is possible here! Do not check this case! It's not a bug, I want it to be this way.
